title.narrative: Support to Palestinian Performing Arts Network (PPAN) 16-21

description.narrative: PPAN is the first Palestinian Performing Arts Network to be established in Palestine as an outcome of Sida's previous support to Abdel Mohsin Qattan Foundation during 2012-2015. The aim of this intervention is to strengthen performing arts capacities, further engage Young women, Children and youth in less privileged communities in performing arts and to bolster functionality, recognition and sustainability of an Active performing arts network.The results framework presented adequate indicators and targets and used the previous program baseline aiming to further develop it and improve it during the first year of the program while developing the monitoring system. The intervention total budget is 48 MSEK and Sida's share is 40 MSEK. The Network plans to diversity its fund base and decrease the support on Swedish through implementing the resource mobilisation strategy. The program budget designated 62% to the program activities, 22% for organisational development and 5.8% for admin cost. A resource mobilisation strategy is already in place and activated . Some donors are already approached during this year to support the Network .

Palestinian Performing Arts Network, PPAN, har ansökt om ett stöd uppgående till 40,4 MSEK för att genomföra ett program kallat "Performing Art is a Right and an Entitlement", ungefär "Scenkonst är en rättighet" under perioden 2016-2019.
Insatsen syftar till att bidra till utvecklingen av ett demokratiskt och pluralistiskt samhälle som respekterar mänskliga rättigheter och förstärker den palestinska identiteten, såsom den uppfattas av nätverkets medlemmar. Insatsen avser öka flickors och pojkars engagemang i scenkonstaktiviteter, särskilt de som lever i marginaliserade och mindre priviligerade områden som tex flyktinglägren i Gaza. PPANs medlemsorganisationer har en lång erfarenhet av att arbeta för jämställdhet mellan könen och demokratiska värden i utsatta områden genom musik, dans, cirkus, teater mm. Insatsen genomförs av nätverket PPAN och nätverkets medlemmar (11 st) i nära samarbete.
Medlemsorganisationerna planerar olika aktiviteter som finansieras via PPAN, som hanterar avtalsskrivande och utbetalning för aktiviteter samt granskar redovisning och rapportering.
Totalbudgeten uppgår till 48,4 MSEK, och PPAN avser söka finaniering från andra givare uppgående till 8 MSEK. Resterande 40,4 MSEK söks från Sida.

tag.narrative: 11.4 - Strengthen efforts to protect and safeguard the world’s cultural and natural heritage.
11.4 - Stärka insatserna för att skydda och trygga världens kultur- och naturarv.

description.narrative:
Results listed below are a sample extracted from the annual reporting of the partner and cannot be seen as a representation of the totality of all achievements under each result area. They also represent a total number accumulated over the years of the programme. According the external evaluation conducted of the programme the overall achievement of objectives measures at:
Outcome1: 95.1%
Outcome2 100%
Outcome3 94.8%
The three outcomes contributed positively for achieving the overall objectives.
a) Functionality, recognition and sustainability of an active performing arts network are bolstered;
General assembly meetings: 6
Members added to the network: 4
Initiatives rewarded: 26
b) Young women, children and youth in less privileged communities are further engaged in performing arts and;
Performances presented: 861
Field visits conducted: 41
Festivals executed: 29
c) Capacities of performing arts are strengthened, diversified and promoted at various levels.
Scholarships given: 870
Students trained: 5983
Throughout the years of implementation the indicators and results shifted a bit with the changes and evolution of the programme. This was mainly as a result of the addition of new donors that adopted and expanded on different elements of implementation like the Swiss Development Cooperation supporting the initiatives component. In addition the last year of implementation was impacted by the global pandemic. So reporting for the year 2020 took on a different nature to allow for the flexibility and adaptation to limitations of the local context and health considerations. 2020 results showed more focus on utilizing social media tools and increased outreach to Palestinians in the Diaspora as a new target audience.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
